intro: Oncostylis kunthiana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are typically large, palmately lobed, and have a rough texture. Oncostylis kunthiana thrives in humid, mountainous environments and is often found in cloud forests.
